content:
• Wednesday, November 29, 2017
  • GTN

    Gray Television -4.6% after pricing 15M-share offering

    • Gray Television (NYSE:GTN) is off 4.6% after hours, following the pricing of a 15M-share offering of common stock.
    • The company's priced the offering at $14.50/share; the stock closed the day at $15.35 and is now quoting after hours at $14.65. Gross proceeds are expected at $217.5M for the treasury, or $250.1M if the greenshoe option is exercised in full.
    • Underwriters still have a 30-day option to buy up to 2.25M more shares of common stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:35 PM | 5 Comments
  • JNPR

    Juniper sheds heavy postmarket gains as Nokia issues deal talk denial

    • Juniper Networks (NYSE:JNPR) -- a top postmarket mover on a CNBC report that Nokia (NYSE:NOK) was preparing a purchase offer -- is rapidly shedding those gains, now up 4.7%, as Nokia issues a denial on the matter.
    • "While Nokia does not typically comment on market rumors, given the specificity of press reports related to a potential acquisition of Juniper Networks, the company issued the following statement: 'Nokia is not currently in talks with, nor is it preparing an offer for, Juniper Networks related to an acquisition of that company,' " Nokia says in a statement just issued.
    • NOK is up 1.4% in postmarket trading. Juniper shares were up as much as 24.7% after hours earlier.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:32 PM | 21 Comments
  • JNPR

    Extreme Networks, Ciena moving after Nokia/Juniper reports

    • Other network technology companies are on the move after hours following reports of discussions by Nokia to buy out Juniper Networks (NYSE:JNPR) at a valuation around $16B.
    • Extreme Networks (NASDAQ:EXTR) is up 1.5% in late trading; Ciena (NASDAQ:CIEN) is up 2.9%; F5 (NASDAQ:FFIV) up 0.9%
    • Juniper is now up 16.8% in postmarket action; NOK up 0.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM | 7 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: JNPR +18.2%. NWY +9.8%. TLYS +9.5%. HOME +7.5%. GLUU +5.9%.
    • Losers: SMTC -10.5%. LLNW -7.8%. JACK -5.8%. BOX -5.3%. MDCO -3.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • TRCO

    Tribune Media -1.3% on word of 7M-share Oaktree offering

    • Tribune Media (NYSE:TRCO) shares have fallen 1.3% after hours after it announced a secondary offering of its class A common stock.
    • The company will sell 7M shares on an underwritten basis by a stockholder affiliated with Oaktree Capital Management, to Morgan Stanley as the underwriter. Tribune isn't selling shares and won't receive proceeds.
    • Morgan Stanley will offer those shares from time to time.
    • The offering is expected to close Dec. 4.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM
  • WIN

    Windstream CFO confident about default face-off with Aurelius

    • Windstream (NASDAQ:WIN) CFO Bob Gunderman expressed confidence about the company's stance as it faces off with Aurelius Capital, which has alleged a Windstream debt default based on its approach to spinning off its infrastructure unit.
    • That comes on the heels of multiple exchange offers and consent solicitations where Windstream is trying to get the alleged default waived. Aurelius' claims are tied to the spinoff of Communications Sales & Leasing, now Uniti Group (NASDAQ:UNIT).
    • “We still feel very confident in our position, we enjoy the support of a very large part of our capital structure,” Gunderman says.
    • He adds that the new notes the company's offering have restrictive covenants that limit the company's leverage before it could execute dividend payments or buybacks. He also sees $750M-$1B in potential asset sales.
    • Aurelius and a trustee noteholder have filed a letter proposing that issues related to Aurelius' claims should be tried in the spring, and that an initial trustee lawsuit alleging default and Aurelius' allegations should be tried together.
    • In action today: WIN +5.5%; UNIT +2.2%.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • Previously: Windstream -2.5% as it launches latest effort to waive alleged default (Nov. 28 2017)
    • Previously: In new filing, Aurelius challenges Windstream debt exchange (Nov. 22 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM | 61 Comments
  • GWRE

    Guidewire Software -5% after Q1 beats, mixed guidance

    • Guidewire Software (NYSE:GWRE) shares are down 5% aftermarket after Q1 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates but included mixed guidance.
    • Q2 guidance: revenue, $152M to $156M (consensus: $144.77M); EPS, $0.17 to $0.21 (consensus: $0.24). 
    • FY18 guidance: revenue, $631M to $641M (consensus: $626.13M); EPS, $0.82 to $0.90 (consensus: $0.95). 
    • Press release  
    • Previously: Guidewire Software beats by $0.08, beats on revenue (Nov. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM
  • TXMD

    TherapeuticsMD resubmits U.S. marketing application for TX-004HR; shares up 1% after hours

    • TherapeuticsMD (NYSEMKT:TXMD) is up 1% after hours on modest volume in response to its refiling of its U.S. marketing application seeking approval for TX-004HR (estradiol vaginal softgel capsule) for the treatment of women with moderate-to-severe vaginal pain during sexual intercourse (dyspareunia).
    • The company received a CRL in April citing the need for long-term safety data.
    • Previously: TherapeuticsMD on go with resubmission of TX-004HR NDA without new pre-approval study; shares ahead 50% premarket (Nov. 6)
    • Previously: TherapeuticsMD provides TX-004HR regulatory update; shares down 20% premarket (April 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM | 2 Comments
  • SNPS

    Synopsys +9.5% after Q4 beats, upside guidance

    • Synopsys (NASDAQ:SNPS) shares are up 9.5% aftermarket following Q4 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates and featured upside guidance.
    • Q1 guidance: revenue, $740M to $765M (consensus: $673.31M); EPS, $0.98 to $1.02 (consensus: $0.84). 
    • FY18 guidance (ex-Black Duck): revenue, $2.82B to $2.855B (consensus: $2.82B); EPS, $3.58 to $3.65 (consensus: $3.57). 
    • FY18 guidance (including Black Duck): revenue, $2.88B to $2.91B; EPS, $3.46 to $3.53. 
    • The acquisition of Black Duck Software should close next month.
    • Revenue breakdown: Time-based products, $527.8M (+$44.7M Y/Y); Upfront products, $75M (-$4.8M); Maintenance and service, $94M (+$23M).
    • Press release      
    • Previously: Synopsys beats by $0.12, beats on revenue (Nov. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • JNPR

    Juniper Networks +22% on report Nokia prepping buyout offer

    • Shares in Juniper Networks (NYSE:JNPR) have jumped 22% after hours as CNBC reports Nokia (NYSE:NOK) is preparing a purchase offer valuing Juniper at $16B (vs. a current value of $11.2B).
    • NOK is off 1.2% in late trading.
    • Buying Juniper would add that company's security/routing services to Nokia's offerings, now focused on the Internet of Things, 5G and cloud solutions.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM | 29 Comments
  • BOX

    Box -5.7% despite revenue beat and in-line EPS, guidance

    • Box (NYSE:BOX) shares are down 5.7% aftermarket despite Q3 results that beat revenue estimates and met on EPS. In-line Q4 guidance has revenue from $136M to $137M (consensus: $137.06M) and EPS from -$0.08 to -$0.07 (consensus: -$0.08).
    • In-line FY18 guidance: revenue, $505M to $506M (consensus: $505.84M); EPS -$0.45 to -$0.44 (consensus: -$0.45).
    • Key metrics: Billings, $141.5M (+26%); deferred revenue, $253M (+31%); cash flow from operations, $14.1M (+$20.9M); FCF, $6.3M (+$17.2M); operating expenses, $137.4M (+$24M); cash and equivalents, $173M (+$5.1M). 
    • Press release  
    • Previously: Box EPS in-line, beats on revenue (Nov. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM | 5 Comments
  • FSLR

    Trump trade rep asks about 'unforeseen developments' ahead of solar tariffs

    • U.S. Trade Representative Lighthizer has asked the U.S. International Trade Commission for a report to help Pres. Trump take “appropriate and feasible action” to support domestic solar panel manufacturers as the White House considers imposing tariffs on low-cost imported panels.
    • Lighthizer specifically asked the U.S. ITC to identify any “unforeseen developments” that led to U.S. companies being harmed, a move that could indicate an effort to head off any challenges at the WTO should Trump impose tariffs - or it could be a sign that Trump is seeking a reason not to impose tariffs at all - says trade policy analyst Clark Packard.
    • If the ITC is unable to point to any unforeseen circumstances, Trump may have an easy reason to say no to Suniva's trade complaint, Packard surmises.
    • Among top solar stocks today: FSLR -3.4%, SPWR -4.8%, CSIQ -3.5%, ENPH -8.6%, VSLR -4.1%, JKS -3.4%, JASO +0.9%, YGE +0.9%.
    • ETFs: TAN, KWT
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 52 Comments
  • T

    AT&T: Seven-year blackout ban shows willingness to concede

    • AT&T (NYSE:T) offered up a seven-year ban on blacking out distributors from Turner (NYSE:TWX) programming, CEO Randall Stephenson says, saying it demonstrates willingness to concede in getting its $85B acquisition to a successful closing.
    • “We’re prepared to make concessions,” Stephenson tells the Economic Club of New York. “What we put in the filing is a concession.”
    • Blackouts have become increasingly common as content providers and distributors clash over continually rising programming costs.
    • Stephenson also said AT&T's request to start its DOJ trial on Feb. 20 is a "reasonable ask," vs. the government's counter of May 7 (which is after the merger's recently extended termination date of April 22).
    • "By agreeing to forgo the option of 'going dark,' AT&T has effectively agreed to abandon what would otherwise be their only real source of leverage in a negotiation," says analyst Craig Moffett.
    • In today's market action: T +3%; TWX +1.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 25 Comments
  • PVH

    Phillips-Van Heusen beats by $0.11, beats on revenue

    • Phillips-Van Heusen (NYSE:PVH): Q3 EPS of $3.02 beats by $0.11.
    • Revenue of $2.36B (+5.4% Y/Y) beats by $20M.
    • Shares +2%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • JACK

    Jack in the Box falls after earnings miss

    • Jack in the Box (NASDAQ:JACK) reports system-wide comparable sales for its eponymous chain fell back 1.0% for in FQ4 to edge past the consensus estimate for a 1.4% decline.
    • Comparable sales at company-owned Jack in the Box stores fell 2.0% vs. -2.3% expected.
    • Comparable sales at Qdoba stores dropped 2.1% vs. -0.2% anticipated.
    • The company lost some sales leverage during the quarter into a labor cost headwind. Consolidated restaurant operating margin decreased by 390 bps Y/Y to 15.8% of sales in the quarter.
    • Previously: Jack In The Box misses by $0.16, misses on revenue (Nov. 29)
    • JACK -6.05% AH to $96.00.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 7 Comments
  • WDAY

    Workday +1.4% after Q3 beats (update)

    • Workday (NYSE:WDAY) shares are up 1.4% aftermarket following Q3 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates.
    • Key metrics: Subscription revenue, $463.6M (+37.2%); operating cash flow, $144M; FCF, $107.7M; cash and equivalents, $3.2B; unearned revenue, $1.2B (+21.5%).
    • Will update with guidance after the conference call.
    • Press release
    • Previously: Workday beats by $0.09, beats on revenue (Nov. 29)
    • Update with guidance: Q4 guidance has revenue from $571M to $573M (consensus: $556.91M) and FY18 has $2.132B to $2.134B (consensus: $2.1B).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM

    Synopsys beats by $0.12, beats on revenue

    Workday beats by $0.09, beats on revenue

    • Shares +4%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 3 Comments
  • UAA

    Apparel stocks jump as retail outlook improves

    • Apparel stocks are riding along with the rally in mall retailers.
    • Notable gainers include Under Armour (UAA +5.6%), Sequential Brands Group (SQBG +6.8%), Vera Bradley (VRA +7.1%), Oxford Industries (OXM +5.2%), Hanesbrands (HBI +2.9%), Columbia Sportswear (COLM +2%), Vince Holdings (VNCE +8.1%) and G-III Apparel (GIII +3.6%), Caleres (CAL +6.1%) and Wolverine World Wide (WWW +3.1%).
    • Previously: Retail rally shifts into higher gear (Nov. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM | 4 Comments
  • LENS

    Presbia continues delisting notice-stoked selloff, shares down 18%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Presbia (LENS -18.2%) slumps on almost triple normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 29K shares, on the heels of a delisting notice from Nasdaq triggered by its failure to maintain the minimum level of stockholders' equity. Shares have sold off 34% since yesterday's intraday high of $3.93.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • AMZN

    Amazon Web Services announces new AI products

    • Amazon Web Services (NASDAQ:AMZN) announces several new AI-backed products at the re: Invent conference.
    • Products: Amazon Rekognition Video for tracking and recognizing people in real-time video streams, Amazon Transcribe, Amazon Comprehend that can detect the sentiment of text, and Amazon Translate. 
    • DeepLens: AWS unveils the $249 DeepLens, a wireless camera for deep learning that comes loaded with the new SageMaker service, which simplifies AI model deployment.
    • DeepLens is powered by an Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) Atom X5 processor.  
    • Kubernetes adoption: Amazon also announces adopting the open-source cloud technology Kubernetes, which was originally developed by a Google team and already has support at Microsoft, Oracle, and IBM.
    • Amazon shares are down 3%.  
    • Previously: Amazon announces new AWS customers, says Cyber Monday biggest day yet (Nov. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM | 11 Comments
  • DDS

    Retail rally shifts into higher gear

    • Investors are placing bets that the solid showing by retailers during Black Friday and through Cyber Monday isn't just a case of chains pulling forward sales intended for December.
    • There are strong share price gains across the sector, led notably by department store names.
    • Perhaps the best news for retail is that store traffic matched last year's levels by most estimates, even with e-commerce spending by U.S. consumers soaring. Also in the mix today is some reshuffling by investors with their portfolio as tax reform nears.
    • Gainers: Dillard's (DDS +9.9%), Sears Holdings (SHLD +6%), J.C. Penney (JCP +3%), Macy's (M +7.4%), Kohl's (KSS +3.5%), TJX Companies (TJX +3.1%), Nordstrom (JWN +7.1%), J. Jill (JILL +8.5%), Express (EXPR +5%), Gap (GPS +4.6%), Buckle (BKE +4.3%), Ross Stores (ROST +3.7%), Target (TGT +8%), Big Lots (BIG +3.5%), Dollar Tree (DLTR +3%), The Container Store (TCS +4.4%), Party City (PRTY +3.3%), Finish Line (FINL +4.6%), Dick's Sporting Goods (DKS +5.1%), Tailored Brands (TLRD +4.8%), Zumiez(ZUMZ +4.2%) and Cato (CATO +3.2%).
    • Retail ETFs: XLY, XRT, VCR, RTH, RETL, FDIS, FXD, RCD, PMR, FTXD, CNDF, EMTY, JHMC
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM | 57 Comments
  • VALE

    Brazil mining code unchanged as Senate fails to vote on bill

    • Brazil’s Senate fails to vote on a temporary decree issue by Pres. Temer that changed some sections of the country's mining code, meaning the decree expired and the original code remains in place.
    • Congress did approve another bill, which creates an autonomous regulatory agency for the mining sector, a move aimed at accelerating slow licensing approvals in the country.
    • Last week, however, lawmakers passed a related proposal that raises mining royalties as part of the same reform agenda.
    • While the higher royalties have been met with criticism from the industry, particularly from top iron ore producer Vale (VALE -2.6%), the government maintains that more efficient regulation under a new agency could offset the higher levies.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • BABA

    Rumor: Alibaba acquires Visualead for $30M to $50M

    • Alibaba (NYSE:BABA) shares are down 4% on rumors that it has acquired Israeli start-up Visualead, which specializes in QR code tech but also has AR.
    • Israel-based Globes’ sources say the deal could fall between $30M and $50M and that Visualead will become part of Alibaba’s DAMO academy software program. 
    • Alibaba invested $5M in Visualead in 2015.   
    • Previously: Alibaba launches $15B R&D expansion (Oct. 11)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM | 26 Comments

  • SCCO

    Southern Copper workers in Peru extend strike to ninth day

    • Southern Copper (SCCO -1.8%) mine workers in Peru complete the ninth day of a strike, following a failed negotiation attempt with the company in seeking a better share of miners’ profits.
    • SCCO operates the Toquepala and Cuajone mines in Peru as well as the Ilo refinery, and produced 900K metric tons of copper last year.
    • Mixed and sometimes contradictory messages from the strike provide a challenge for investors to gauge the impact on supply: SCCO says the strike is affecting ~25% of workers while the unions say they represent nearly 70% of the workforce, and SCCO says the smelter is operating normally and Ilo operations are "the least" affected by the strike while the unions have called on workers to focus on Ilo.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • MSFT

    Windows 10 reaches 600M active monthly devices

    • Microsoft’s (NASDAQ:MSFT) Windows 10 is now installed on 600M active monthly devices, according to CEO Satya Nadella’s comments at the annual shareholder meeting.
    • Windows 10 reached 500M devices in May.
    • Microsoft’s original goal was to have Windows 10 on 1B devices by 2018 but abandoned that goal last year as the company began to give up on Windows Phone.
    • Sources told The Verge earlier this year that the new goal was 550M active devices by the end of June and 575M by the end of September. 
    • Sources: GeekWire / The Verge    
    • Microsoft shares are down 1.6%.    
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 18 Comments
  • BNTC

    Benitec reports Q1 results

    • Benitec (NASDAQ:BNTC): Q1 Net loss of A$2.9M
    • Cash and equivalent of A$14.7M
    • Shares +3%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • AAPL

    Apple auditing software development process after macOS flaw

    • Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) says it will review its software development process after releasing a software update to fix a security vulnerability in macOS High Sierra.
    • Apple statement, via Reuters: “We greatly regret this error and we apologize to all Mac users. Our customers deserve better. We are auditing our development processes to help prevent this from happening again.” 
    • The company said that security “is a top priority” but “regrettably we stumbled with the release of Mac OS.” 
    • Apple shares are down 2.6%.    
    • Previously: Apple rushes to fix OS security issue (Nov. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM | 38 Comments
  • RAD

    Big bounce for Rite Aid and Fred's

    • Rite Aid (RAD +18%) and Fred's (FRED +5.6%) break higher in moves being attributed to strong consumer spending reads and some peeling away of fears that Amazon will disrupt the pharmacy business.
    • Earlier this week, Rite Aid began the process of turning over its sold stores to Walgreens, most of which are located in the southeastern part of the U.S.
    • Previously: Rite Aid and Walgreen begin store transfer process (Nov. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 63 Comments
  • AAN

    Sidoti & Co. bullish on Aaron's

    • Sidoti & Co. upgrades Aaron's (AAN +2.4%) to a Buy rating after having the retailer set at Neutral.
    • The investment firm's price target of $45 reps 22% upside potential for shares.
    • The 52-week trading range of Aaron's is $26.12 to $48.22. Shares are currently swapping hands at around $37.79.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM

    • Gainers: TELL +9%. PKD-OLD +7%. WLB +5%.
    • Losers: CNX -17%. DELT -11%. MCF -10%. TROX -10%. CENX -9%.

  • INNV

    Innovus Pharma's Zestra OK'd in Malaysia; shares up 3%

    • Malaysia's Ministry of Health has approved Innovus Pharmaceuticals' (OTCQB:INNV +3.1%) Zestra as a cosmetic. The product, a blend of natural oils, is used to treat Female Sexual Arousal Disorder.  Distribution partner Bio Task SDN BHD will market.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM
  • LB

    B. Riley confident on L Brands

    • B. Riley backs its bullish view on L Brands (LB +0.4%) after factoring in the retailer's earnings report posted two weeks ago.
    • The investment firm keeps a Buy rating and price target of $58 on L Brands.
    • L Brands is seen as improving its square footage strategy and benefiting from strong consumer confidence.
    • Shares of LB trade near the mid-point of their 52-week range of $35.00 to $75.50.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM | 3 Comments
  • FOX

    Fox's Murdoch: We'd never buy CNN

    • Giving color to one asset-sale prospect in the merger between AT&T (T +2.5%) and Time Warner (TWX +1.1%), Lachlan Murdoch says that Twenty-First Century Fox (FOX +3%, FOXA +3.2%) would never be interested in buying news network CNN.
    • CNN has become a much-discussed potential bargaining chip in the merger talks, with claims and counterclaims that selling the network might be required for the merger to get DOJ approval. AT&T chief Randall Stephenson has said he's not open to selling CNN.
    • Meanwhile, Fox is in its own discussions to sell assets, though it expects to retain its broadcast, sports and cable-leading news operations.
    • Murdoch, Fox's executive chairman, told a Business Insider conference that ”We wouldn’t be allowed to buy CNN and we would never be interested in buying CNN." The company might be legally allowed to own both Fox News and CNN but such a deal would draw antitrust scrutiny.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM | 66 Comments
  • LVS

    Japan gaming license tussle seen lasting up to two years

    • Casino gaming is likely to be legalized in Japan in 2018 to set up a one to two years tussle between operators for the three critical licenses, forecasts Spectrum Gaming Group as part of its broad outlook on the industry.
    • Las Vegas Sands (LVS -1.2%), MGM Resorts (MGM +1.4%), Wynn Resorts (WYNN -0.9%), Melco Resorts & Entertainment (MLCO -1.6%) and Genting Group and are among the heavy hitters looking win a license, perhaps in partnership with a domestic player.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM | 8 Comments
  • XNET

    Xunlei -22% after it issues clarifier on Big Data relationship

    • Xunlei Limited (NASDAQ:XNET) -- recently trading with high volatility due to its linkage with cryptocurrency and Bitcoin -- is off 22.2% today after it issued a release clarifying its approach to its digital token product, which is driving some investors to the exits.
    • Responding to comments from Shenzhen Xunlei Big Data Information Services, Xunlei says it has a 28.77% equity interest in Big Data but no management control, and it has asked terminated Big Data's right to use the Xunlei brand.
    • With regard to digital tokens, Xunlei says it "believes that Wankebi is a kind of digital asset and can be used on the company's Internet properties and should not be traded on other transaction platforms," and says Wankebi is a "symbol of proof" for Xunlei's applications, "rather than a subject of speculation."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM | 7 Comments

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:15 PM

    • Gainers: PFSI +6%. SLM +6%.CACC +5%. CVCY +5%. CNFR +5%.
    • Losers: GROW -10%. ATLC -10%. OPHC -10%. FRSX -7%. SGLB -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM
  • DXCM

    DexCom up 4% on potential CGM opportunity with UnitedHealth

    • DexCom (DXCM +3.5%) is up on average volume on the heels of its announcement of a partnership with UnitedHealth Group (UNH +3%) aimed at using continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) in an integrated effort to manage patients with type 2 diabetes in a more cost-effective way.
    • Specifically, UNH plans to use CGM data in addition to a patient's diet and exercise activity with the aim of modifying the patient's behavior to better manage blood sugar levels. Significant cost savings are likely if patients are able to alter their lifestyle (better diet, more exercise) and avoid transitioning to more expensive drugs.
    • The partnership will start with a 10K-subject study that will roll out over the next six-to-nine months. If successful, UNH will implement a network-wide initiative over the following several years.
    • The type 2 space is much larger that type 1 so a successful program would bode well for DexCom's CGM system.
    • Source: Company webcast posted 11/29.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM | 4 Comments
  • TEUM

    Pareteum regains listing compliance with NYSE

    • After getting an extension in the summer, Pareteum (TEUM -11.8%) says it's now back in compliance with NYSE listing standards.
    • It had been warned by NYSE American regarding compliance with standards for minimum shareholders' equity and minimum stock price, and the extension gave it until this past Monday to remedy.
    • It's cured deficiencies now, it says. "Our efforts in that regard, from a shareholders' equity position, are, we believe, a reflection of our success in growing our mobile Cloud Communications Platform," says founder/Chairman Hal Turner.
    • Shares had risen 5% during the session yesterday after it announced a three-year deal with a China-focused MVNO.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • AXTA

    Report: Axalta Coating near agreement on sale to Nippon Paint

    • Axalta Coating Systems (AXTA +3.2%) is higher following a Dealreporter article that Nippon Paint is close to a takeover agreement with AXTA's board, with a deal expected to be announced this week or early next week.
    • According to Dealreporter, the takeover is expected to be all cash and at a premium to the current share price, according to contacts.
    • AXTA reportedly canceled merger talks last week with Akzo Nobel after receiving a better offer from Nippon Paint.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: CERC +71%. PTI +23%. RAD +18%. DPW +16%. OOMA +15%. PLSE +14%. MARA +13%. NERV +12%. DL +11%. ATKR +11%.
    • Losers: CVO -21%. XNET -19%. CNX -16%. MYO -16%. ADSK -15%. DAIO -15%. NURO -13%. EKSO -12%. ESIO -12%. TEUM -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 9 Comments
  • SCG

    Report: Scana hires bank to consider possible sale

    • Scana (SCG +1.7%) is higher following a report from The State newspaper that South Carolina Gov. McMaster is seeking to sell Santee Cooper, four months after the state-owned utility and SCG quit their joint $9B nuclear project.
    • According to the report, the governor's office is in talks with four out-of-state utilities - NextEra Energy (NEE), Duke Energy (DUK +0.2%), Southern Co. (SO -0.7%) and Dominion Energy (NYSE:D) - about a potential sale, and the same four utilities also would like to buy SCG to increase the size of their footprint in the state.

  • PRQR

    ProQR's QR-313 an Orphan Drug in Europe for DEB; shares up 2%

    • The European Medicines Agency (EMA) designates ProQR Therapeutics' (PRQR +1.5%) QR-313 an Orphan Drug for the treatment of dystrophic epidermolysis bullosa (DEB), an inherited disorder characterized by skin blisters.
    • QR-313 is an RNA-based oligonucleotide designed to address the underlying genetic cause of DEB.
    • Among the benefits of Orphan Drug status in Europe is a 10-year period of market exclusivity for the indication, if approved.
    • The FDA designated QR-313 an Orphan Drug for DEB several months ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 3 Comments

  • NLST

    Netlist +3% after ITC opens investigation into patent infringement claims

    • The U.S. International Trade Commission voted to investigation certain memory module components based on a complaint filed by Netlist (OTC:NLST) at the end of October.
    • Netlist accused SK Hynix subsidiaries of patent infringement and asked the ITC to issue limited exclusion and cease and desist orders. 
    • Launching the investigation doesn’t mean the ITC has decided on the merits of the case. The Commissions’ Chief Administrative Law Judge will assign the case to another judge for scheduling an evidentiary hearing. 
    • The ITC has 45 days from the launch to set a target end date for the investigation.  
    • Netlist shares are up 3%.

  • NPSNY

    Naspers profits jump, with boost from one-third Tencent stake

    • Naspers (OTCPK:NPSNY) ADRS are 1% lower in over-the-counter trading after posting first-half profits that rose 65% backed by strength in the South African firm's Internet businesses (and with no little help from its stake in China's Tencent).
    • Revenues were up 33% on a headline basis and 39% if excluding acquisitions/disposals and currency. Businesses outside South Africa contributed 82% of revenues.
    • Core headline earnings rose to $1.5B vs. a year-ago $914M.
    • “E-commerce accelerated its topline growth, whilst Tencent produced another excellent set of results," says the company chair Koos Bekker. (It holds the largest stake in Tencent (TCEHY -4.7%), about a third.)
    • "Video entertainment performed solidly in South Africa and managed to stabilize losses in sub-Saharan Africa, despite the continued need to navigate weak macroeconomic conditions," Bekker says.
    • Revenue breakout: Internet, $6.9B (up 42%); Video entertainment, $1.8B (up 8%).
    • It's "working hard" to narrow the difference between the value of its business and the one-third stake in Tencent, CFO Basil Sgourdos tells Bloomberg: “The discount is at an unusually high level, and there is no reason for the discount to be at this level." The Tencent shareholding is worth about $166B, while Naspers itself is worth about $124B.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM | 6 Comments

  • LBTYA

    Report: Liberty Global eyes exit from Switzerland, Austria

    • Liberty Global (LBTYA +7.5%) is exploring an exit from its Swiss and Austrian businesses, according to the Daily Telegraph.
    • The company's in early-stage talks to dispose of UPC Austria and UPC Switzerland, sources tell the paper. Those "CHAT" businesses have been lagging others at the company.
    • Former state monopoly Swisscom has been competing aggressively with UPC Switzerland on broadband pricing, and the latter posted revenues of $1.36B last year. Smaller UPC Austria has revenues of $342M and could be sold separately or as a CHAT package deal with the Swiss business.
    • The moves could help advance a long-discussed $175B merger with Vodafone (VOD +0.4%), the Telegraph suggests.

    Amazon announces new AWS customers, says Cyber Monday biggest day yet

    • Amazon Web Services (NASDAQ:AMZN) announces new cloud service agreements with Expedia, Disney, and the National Football League.

    • AWS still led the cloud services market in Q3, according to Canalys data, with a 42% year-over-year growth to a 32% share. But Microsoft’s Azure grew 90% in the same period for a 14% share. Google Cloud grew 76% to a 6% share.

  • ALDX

    Aldeyra's ADX-102 on par with steroid eye drop in mid-stage uveitis study; shares down 2%

    • New analyses of a Phase 2 clinical trial evaluating Aldeyra Therapeutics' (ALDX -1.5%) topical reproxalap (formerly ADX-102) in patients with noninfectious anterior uveitis showed it to be non-inferior (no worse than) to Pred Forte (prednisone acetate), a topical steroid for ophthalmic use, in reducing anterior chamber inflammatory cell count. The data were presented at the American Academy of Ophthalmology Annual Meeting in New Orleans.
    • A Phase 3 study was launched in April with topline results expected in H2 2018.
    • Reproxalap is an aldehyde-binding molecule or aldehyde trap. By decreasing aldehyde load, it may mitigate excessive inflammation caused by excess aldehydes. It was unsuccessful in a mid-stage conjunctivitis study reported in June.
    • Previously: Aldeyra advances lead product candidate into Phase 3 development (Jan. 25)
    • Previously: Aldeyra's lead product candidate flunks mid-stage allergic conjunctivitis study; shares down 19% premarket (June 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM

  • CMG

    Chipotle rallies as investors back new direction

    • Shares of Chipotle (NYSE:CMG) are up 4.62% after the company signals that it will hire a new CEO.
    • William Blair isn't taking the news in a positive way, downgrading CMG to Market Perform from Outperform on concerns over the uncertain transition.
    • Mizuho Secutities likes the strategy from the restaurant operator. "This news is unexpected given the recent moves to streamline the CEO position, but is an absolutely critical, important next chapter for Chipotle, which has been struggling to recover sales under Ells," writes analyst Jeremy Scott in a fresh note. "We believe the move today will help to restore confidence in the board, the activist, and in the stock," he adds.
    • The search committee at Chipotle tasked with finding a new CEO includes director Robin Hickenlooper, departing CEO Steve Ells and Pershing Square's Ali Namvar.
    • Who gets the job? One name to watch is ex-Panera CEO Ron Shaich, who is highly regarded in the restaurant industry. Shaich, who also served on Whole Foods board, has voiced displeasure with activist investors in the past, which could scratch him off the Pershing Square list. Also, don't rule out an international hire for Chipotle after McDonald's hit a home run with Steve Easterbrook's hiring in 2015.
    • Previously: Chipotle starts search for new CEO (Nov. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM | 6 Comments

  • PHIO

    RXi Pharma's RXI-231 shows positive effect in consumer testing program; shares ahead 13% premarket

    • Nano cap RXi Pharmaceuticals (RXII) is up 13% premarket on modestly higher volume in response to its announcement of positive results from a consumer testing program assessing the ability of RXI-231 to reduce skin pigmentation caused by exposure to UV light.
    • The consumer testing program consisted of three studies, two in volunteers to evaluate the safety of the topical gel (skin irritation/sensitivity). The third evaluated its impact on the increase in skin melanin content (pigmentation) induced by UV exposure. Results showed RXI-231 can reduce the change in skin tone triggered by UV.
    • RXI-231 targets an enzyme called TYR that plays a key role in the synthesis of melanin.
